<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cachepruningpolicy"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cachepruningpolicy">CachePruningPolicy</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The pruning interval. This is intended to be used to avoid scanning the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// directory too often. It does not impact the decision of which file to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// prune. A value of 0 forces the scan to occur. A value of std::nullopt</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// disables pruning.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cachepruningpolicy/#a26f65d4efd088dd6f035a970ef350628"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::optional&lt;std::chrono::seconds&gt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cachepruningpolicy/#a26f65d4efd088dd6f035a970ef350628">Interval</a> = std::chrono::seconds(1200);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The expiration for a file. When a file hasn&#39;t been accessed for Expiration</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// seconds, it is removed from the cache. A value of 0 disables the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// expiration-based pruning.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cachepruningpolicy/#a4e4e128e83c615ca4ed425980b41e64f"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::chrono::seconds <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cachepruningpolicy/#a4e4e128e83c615ca4ed425980b41e64f">Expiration</a> = std::chrono::hours(7 &#42; 24); </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 1w</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The maximum size for the cache directory, in terms of percentage of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// available space on the disk. Set to 100 to indicate no limit, 50 to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// indicate that the cache size will not be left over half the available disk</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// space. A value over 100 will be reduced to 100 A value of 0 disables the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// percentage size-based pruning.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cachepruningpolicy/#ac13a6c169c6b44529d9f6bae76c8b4ed"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cachepruningpolicy/#ac13a6c169c6b44529d9f6bae76c8b4ed">MaxSizePercentageOfAvailableSpace</a> = 75;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The maximum size for the cache directory in bytes. A value over the amount</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// of available space on the disk will be reduced to the amount of available</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// space. A value of 0 disables the absolute size-based pruning.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cachepruningpolicy/#a8c514fa2ef23ee2f092cedf2691886dd"><span class="doxyHighlight">  uint64&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cachepruningpolicy/#a8c514fa2ef23ee2f092cedf2691886dd">MaxSizeBytes</a> = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The maximum number of files in the cache directory. A value of 0 disables</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the number of files based pruning.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This defaults to 1000000 because with that many files there are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// diminishing returns on the effectiveness of the cache. Some systems have a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// limit on total number of files, and some also limit the number of files</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// per directory, such as Linux ext4, with the default setting (block size is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 4096 and large&#95;dir disabled), there is a per-directory entry limit of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 508&#42;510&#42;floor(4096/(40+8))~=20M for average filename length of 40</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cachepruningpolicy/#a0b73cd4206ae3e5edc07c24afb2057ac"><span class="doxyHighlight">  uint64&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cachepruningpolicy/#a0b73cd4206ae3e5edc07c24afb2057ac">MaxSizeFiles</a> = 1000000;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Parse the given string as a cache pruning policy. Defaults are taken from a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// default constructed CachePruningPolicy object.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// For example: &quot;prune&#95;interval=30s:prune&#95;after=24h:cache&#95;size=50%&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// which means a pruning interval of 30 seconds, expiration time of 24 hours</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// and maximum cache size of 50% of available disk space.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/expected">Expected&lt;CachePruningPolicy&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a4accb2c6a0d7504200a547f2284ff106">parseCachePruningPolicy</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> PolicyStr);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Peform pruning using the supplied policy, returns true if pruning</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// occurred, i.e. if Policy.Interval was expired.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Check whether cache pruning happens using the supplied policy, adds a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ThinLTO warning if cache&#95;size&#95;bytes or cache&#95;size&#95;files is too small for the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// current link job. The warning recommends the user to consider adjusting</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// --thinlto-cache-policy.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// As a safeguard against data loss if the user specifies the wrong directory</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// as their cache directory, this function will ignore files not matching the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// pattern &quot;llvmcache-&#42;&quot;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aabba6d27907082520ad2eb977c8e406b">pruneCache</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Path, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cachepruningpolicy">CachePruningPolicy</a> Policy,</span></CodeLine>
